clauses.title: Service Level Agreement
clauses.summary: Provider guarantees 99.9% uptime with penalties for non-compliance.

clauses.title: Force Majeure
clauses.summary: Neither party liable for delays due to circumstances beyond reasonable control.

clauses.title: Payment Terms
clauses.summary: Monthly payments due within 30 days of invoice date with 1.5% monthly late fees.

clauses.title: Confidentiality
clauses.summary: Both parties must protect confidential information for 5 years post-termination.

insights.message: SLA penalties are capped at 10% of monthly fees, which may not adequately compensate for significant outages.
Force majeure clause is overly broad and may excuse performance in situations that should be foreseeable.
Late payment fees compound monthly, potentially creating significant financial exposure.

evidence.snippet: Provider shall maintain network availability of at least 99.9% measured monthly. For each full percentage point below 99.9%, Customer shall receive a credit equal to 10% of the monthly service fee, provided such credits shall not exceed 10% of monthly fees in any given month.

Neither party shall be liable for any delay or failure to perform due to causes beyond its reasonable control, including but not limited to acts of God, war, terrorism, labor disputes, or government actions.
Any amounts not paid when due shall bear interest at the rate of one and one-half percent (1.5%) per month or the maximum rate permitted by law, whichever is less.
